awd_titl_txt: Type I:  Establishment of an NSF I-Corps Site at the University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

inst.inst_name: The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS RIO GRANDE VALLEY

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: University of Texas Rio Grande Valley

por.por_cntn:
UTRGV had a site level I-Corps program from 8/18 to 1/25

Over the years as an I-Corps site we conducted at least 2 level site trainings per semester with 100's of students per year exposed to the I-Corps methodolgy. We also conducted 14 regional level trainings with 86 teams 340 participants and 20 teams recommended to nationals. One of our first teams that went to nationals currently has an SBIR for their technology. Several teams that got approved for nationals were not able to go as the cohort was cancelled due to the budget freeze of 2020. We currently have a team that is going to nationals and 3 others pending.  

.

Broader impacts:

Our program started in one department but ultimately spread to include faculty from over 20 different departments - which we see as a key success. The most common feedback from our participants was 1. They learned the value of talking to customers to inform their research and 2. That they developed the softskills necessary to conduct said interviews

Also as an Hispanic Serving Insiture with a 95% Hispanic student body we were able to teach over a thousand students about the I-Corps methodolgy and expsoe them to innovation and the business world.

Intellectual Merit

We created a Hybrid training mehodogy that compressed the regional training model with offsite training and customer discovery conducted in Houston as the Rio Grande Valley did not offer a sufficent level of business and industries to conduct fruitful customer discovery interviews.


Last Modified: 04/22/2025
Modified by: Russell Adams
